mobs.long_desc: A white fox with bright black eyes tries to evade you.
mobs.desc: This is no ordinary fox. Its coat is a lustrous, pearly white, shot through with fine silver hairs. It's a lithe, muscular beast, whose camouflage is broken only by a pair of glittering black eyes that regard you with almost human intelligence.

mobs.long_desc: A small bird darts for cover as you approach.
mobs.desc: This is one fast little bird. Standing no more than knee high, this quail is nevertheless a fierce little fighter. Perhaps she is defending a nest. She squawks at you while she tries to peck your eyes out with her beak and claw you with her little yellow feet.

mobs.long_desc: A retired military officer warms herself by the fire.
mobs.desc: A half-Elven woman of some age, Post Commander Lyara carries herself with the poise and confidence of a well-trained soldier, but softened some by years in retirement.  Her overall appearance is well maintained but unadorned, much like her home, indicating a concentration on function over appearance.  Her grey hair is pulled back and neat, perfectly framing her gently aging face.  The only truly unsual part of her appearance is her scintillating purple irises, suggesting there is more to her than meets the eye.

mobs.long_desc: A barbarian woman dressed entirely in pelts tends the lodge.
mobs.desc: The barbarian woman who stands before you is a respected member of the Berserker Guild, a loose comradery of frenzied warriors.  She is dressed head to toe in rough animal pelts, surely not warm enough to keep the freezing arctic winds from chilling her bones.  But perhaps external warmth is unnecessary for one such as her.  It is said the berserk rage from which the guild takes its name stokes the inner fires of the soul and keeps one alive through fire, frost, or frenzy.

objects.ground: A pair of odd glasses rests on a desk.

extras.text: At first glance, these lenses don't seem to have much of a purpose.  A prismatic chitinous stick hangs off one side like the handle on opera glasses or a masquerade mask, yet the lenses still have arms to hold them in place above the ears like spectacles The glass is of uneven thickness and shape, not conforming to any specific geometry.  Only by holding them up to your eyes and looking through them can you begin to see the subtle refraction of magical energies the lenses detect.

Remember, this quest must be undertaken &1&bALONE&0.  If you are grouped when you fight your prey, there will be consequences!' else return 0 endif

No groups allowed!&0 eval zone ((%self.vnum% / 100) - 1) switch %zone% case 160 msend %person% %self.name% whips you with her tail and sends you flying into a sandstorm! mechoaround %person% %self.name% whips %person.name% with her tail and sends %himher% flying into a sandstorm! mechoaround %person% %person.name% is gone! set random %random.86% break case 162 msend %person% %self.name% howls and sends you fleeing in terror! mechoaround %person% %self.name% howls and sends %person.name% fleeing in terror! mechoaround %person% %person.name% is gone! set random %random.81% break case 202 msend %person% %self.name% roars and hurdles you into the blinding heat! mechoaround %person% %self.name% roars and hurdles %person.name% into the blinding heat! mechoaround %person% %person.name% is gone! set random %random.79% break case 551 default msend %person% %self.name% roars and hurdles you into the blinding snow! mechoaround %person% %self.name% roars and hurdles %person.name% into the blinding snow! mechoaround %person% %person.name% is gone! set random %random.100% set zone 554 done eval place ((%zone% * 100) + 99 + %random%) mteleport %person% %place% mforce %person% look endif endif set person %person.next_in_room% done

rooms.name: The Beginning of the Folly
rooms.description: You struggle to breathe the bitterly cold, pure air.  Here you see the beginning of what the Master Engineer Sirestis hoped would become a vast western road that would run all the way to the oceans to the far, far west. The road's not quite built yet.  That is to say, the foundation has been dug and leveled, but it's not paved yet.  In fact, there is little here to indicate that a road exists other than a slightly flattened area.  The town of Ickle's mighty west gate lies immediately to the east.

West.description: The unfinished road continues to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: You travel with difficulty down this very unfinished road.  You had heard of how the people of Ickle barely tolerated the engineer-wizard Sirestis, but how he kept talking about his vision -- of a road that would unite Ickle with the mysterious and uncharted lands to the west.  The road runs far to the west. Ickle is nearby to the east.

East.description: The road begins to the east. Ickle lies a little further away.

West.description: The road runs far to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: This road reflects the longstanding belief of the master engineer Sirestis that Ickle should explore in all directions.  Though he began the project, no one knows where he is now, or what has become of all his plans.  The road runs east-west here, its surface packed snow.

East.description: The road runs to the east, to the city of Ickle.

West.description: The road runs far to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: This road might once have been a trail, but someone has tried to make it into an actual road.  Road-building implements like shovels and rollers are scattered here and there, as if the road crews simply ran away from their jobs. The cold here is incredible; packed snow and ice makes traveling treacherous.

East.description: The road runs far to the east, ending at a city.

West.description: The road runs far to the west. Up ahead, far away, you think you can see a fork in the road.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: It's cold!  You shiver, looking around at this half-built road.  It'll be grand one day.  The recently fallen snow has fallen onto the road, piling by the sides of the road.  Going north or south is out of the question -- you have no idea how deep that snow could be.

East.description: The road runs far to the east, ending at a city.

West.description: You see a fork in the road, but the main east-west road runs far to the west.

rooms.name: A Fork in the Road
rooms.description: The road, which runs east-west, still runs far to the west, a barely-packed down ribbon of snow cutting through the snowbanks.  A fork that is barely a trail begins here and leads off to the south.

East.description: The road runs far to the east.

South.description: A primitively made path begins to the south.

West.description: The road runs far to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: This road will hopefully, one day, be a major thoroughfare.  Right now, you have to watch your step, lest you slip in the snow that covers this entire region!  It'd be sheer foolishness to go north or south, since one misstep in that mountain of snow would be your death, but you can go east or west.

East.description: The road continues to the east. Nearby, you see a fork in the road.

West.description: The road continues to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: You stand in the middle of a snow-covered road that runs far to the east and west.  It's clearly still in the process of being built, and you wonder who started it, and why -- or perhaps you don't, having heard the stories of the mad engineer Sirestis.

East.description: The road runs as far east as your eye can see.

West.description: The road runs far to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: This roadway is barely more than a flat, carriage-wide expanse of ground running east-west.  While it might not seem like an accomplishment, it is; you know that if you were to stray from this road, you could end up over your head in snow in those innocent-seeming snowbanks to the north and south.

East.description: The road runs far to the east.

West.description: The road runs far to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: You suspect that this half-completed road used to be a trail of some kind. You suspect this because you think you can see something far to the north, though you can't reach it from here.  You can see the implements of the road-builders' trade here and there, scattered around in the snow.

East.description: The road runs far to the east.

West.description: The road runs far to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: You stand in the middle of a half-built road.  Right now it's little more than started -- a level surface cutting through all the hills of snow.  Here and there tools lie in the snow, which strikes you as distinctly shoddy workmanship.  You can head east or west from here.

East.description: The road runs as far east as your eye can see.

West.description: The road runs far to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: Nothing but white, as far as you can see in every direction; white road, white hills surrounding, white mountains.  Here and there a bit of green from a tree peeks out at you from off the road.  You wish the road were paved or something, anything to make the footing a bit easier.  The road runs east-west here.

East.description: The runs far to the east.

West.description: The road goes a short way to the west, before gently curving out of sight.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: You stand in the middle of a snow-covered road.  It's not paved, though someone has been kind enough to at least flatten the road surface.  It's about wide enough for an entire carriage to traverse safely.  To the north, a narrower path begins.  The road itself runs east-west.

East.description: The main road runs far to the east.

West.description: The road curves slightly to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: The road is frozen over, and unpaved.  You are grateful that it has at least been levelled, or you would not trust the footing here.  The road makes a graceful curve, running east-south here.

East.description: The road runs as far east as the eye can see.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: In your adventures, you've never thought about what might lie at the end of this road.  Hopefully nothing too dangerous!  The road isn't paved, and you'd be a lot more worried about your safety in using it if you didn't know it has already been levelled.  You've never seen a road like this.

West.description: The road runs a short distance to the west. Beyond that, all you see is snow and more snow.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: You stand on a short stretch of road that curves out of sight to the east and west.  It looks largely unfinished, as though whoever made it ran out of funding in the middle of building it.  At least it's been levelled, so the footing is steady, if a bit slippery at times from packed snow.

East.description: The road curves up ahead.

West.description: The road curves up ahead.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: The road cuts through the snow-covered hills like a knifeblade, a white ribbon slicing through the terrain.  It curves here, but you don't know why. Perhaps it does so to avoid unseen pits in the surrounding countryside.  It runs east-south here.

East.description: The road curves to the east.

South.description: The road curves to the south.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: You stand in the center of a long, long road that evidently hasn't been here very long.  It has a new air to it.  Perhaps half-finished is the proper word. It looks like someone started it, then decided to blow off to the nearest tavern for beers halfway through building it.

West.description: The road runs a ways to the west.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: The sunlight reflects off of the snow, sparkling like diamonds.  This road runs east-west here, ending far in the distance to the west, and curving to the north not far away.  This road isn't quite finished, or, rather, it's been barely begun, though obviously a long time ago, as if it were started years ago, then left just as it'd been begun.

East.description: The road runs a short way to the east before curving out of sight.

West.description: The road goes a short way to the west before it ends.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: The road seems particularly primitive right here.  It's barely level; potholes, dips, and pits make footing treacherous, if not downright dangerous, since a thick cloak of snow covers it all.  You can see nothing but sparkling white snow everywhere you look.

East.description: The road goes a short way to the east before curving out of sight.

West.description: The road continues to the west before ending not far away.

rooms.name: Sirestis' Folly
rooms.description: The road here is little more than a path.  No one has come here in so long that the only thing that makes you able to recognize that this is a road is the slight indentation that cuts through the surrounding hills.  It runs east-west here.

East.description: The road runs a ways to the east.

West.description: The road ends to the west.

rooms.name: Folly's End
rooms.description: You stand at what is clearly the end of the road: Right here, the somewhat more level road ends, and the hillside and surrounding countryside takes over. A pickaxe, rusted and useless now, lies embedded in the icy ground, its handle high in the air as if someone couldn't even be bothered to pull it out of the ice before he left.  A sign on a post stands here. To the south, a large building sits, partially obscured by what looks like clouds.

East.description: The road runs a ways to the east.

South.description: A large building is partially obscured by smoke to the south.

extras.text: The sign is written with spiky runish letters. It reads: Travelers beware -- the western lands abound with dangers of unknown nature. The terrain is far too dangerous for any travel at this time. This is the only warning I can give. It is signed with a single word, probably a name: "Sirestis".

rooms.name: A Snow-Covered Path
rooms.description: This path, barely wide enough for two or three people to walk abreast, is covered in snow.  There's little to see here, aside from snow-covered hills, and the occasional snow-shrouded evergreen tree.  The path runs to the south; to the north, it intersects with a larger road.

North.description: You see a slightly more sophisticated road to the north.

South.description: The path continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Snow-Covered Path
rooms.description: This path, barely wide enough for two or three people to walk abreast, is covered in snow.  A tiny ramshackle hut stands off the path to the east. Otherwise there's little to see here, aside from snow-covered hills, and the occasional snow-shrouded evergreen tree.  The path runs north-south here.

North.description: The path continues to the north a short way before intersecting with another, larger road.

East.description: A rickety door stands in the entrance to a ramshackle hut.

South.description: The path curves to the west up ahead.

rooms.name: A Snow-Covered Path
rooms.description: This path, barely wide enough for two or three people to walk abreast, is covered in snow.  There's little to see here, aside from snow-covered hills, and the occasional snow-shrouded evergreen tree.  The path runs north-west here.

North.description: The path continues to the north a ways.

West.description: The path curves out of sight here.

rooms.name: A Snow-Covered Path
rooms.description: This path, barely wide enough for two or three people to walk abreast, is covered in snow.  There's little to see here, aside from snow-covered hills, and the occasional snow-shrouded evergreen tree.  The path runs east-south here.

East.description: The path runs a short way to the east before curving out of sight.

South.description: The path continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Snow-Covered Path
rooms.description: This path, barely wide enough for two or three people to walk abreast, is covered in snow.  There's little to see here, aside from snow-covered hills, and the occasional snow-shrouded evergreen tree.  The path runs north-south here.

North.description: The path continues to the north before curving out of sight.

South.description: The path continues to the south before curving out of sight.

rooms.name: A Snow-Covered Path
rooms.description: This path, barely wide enough for two or three people to walk abreast, is covered in snow.  There's little to see here, aside from snow-covered hills, and the occasional snow-shrouded evergreen tree.  The path runs north-west here.

North.description: The path continues to the north a short distance.

rooms.name: A Snow-Covered Path
rooms.description: This path, barely wide enough for two or three people to walk abreast, is covered in snow.  There's little to see here, aside from snow-covered hills, and the occasional snow-shrouded evergreen tree.  The trail runs east-south here.

East.description: The path curves here.

rooms.name: The End of the Snow-Covered Path
rooms.description: This path, barely wide enough for two or three people to walk abreast, is covered in snow.  There's little to see here, aside from snow-covered hills, and the occasional snow-shrouded evergreen tree.  The path ends here; the blazed trail is reclaimed by the arctic tundra.  With some effort, you might be able to dig through the snow blocking the path to the south.

North.description: The path continues to the north.

rooms.name: A Small Arctic Cabin
rooms.description: This cabin, seeming tiny and ramshackle on the outside, is bigger on the inside!  That said, the quaint single-room wooden structure is still quite small.  Not nearly as dilapidated as the exterior would have you believe, the interior lacks the ostentatiousness one might expect from a magically enhanced domicile.  The walls are a simple unadorned daub and plaster, made weather-tight with a combination of sweat and illusions.  In the fireplace, positioned near the center of the cabin, a small fire crackles defiantly against the perpetual cold of the north.  Standing near the fireplace is a large cushioned chair and a small table.

rooms.name: A Hunting Lodge
rooms.description: Half-buried in the snow stands an old wooden building barely secured against the arctic weather.  The inside is decorated with countless trophies - roughly mounted heads and horns of enormous beasts claimed in great hunts over the years.  Tribal glyphs mark this lodge as a gathering place of the northern Barbarian tradition of Berserkers.
